column4: hello.. can anyone help me with hardware select for buying new computer
Sure.
What do you need to know?
hm, i want something on intel i5.. but i dont know what chipset on motherboard i need to buy
All Intel motherboards are guaranteed to work with Ubuntu
nice, but i looking for good hardware "list" to buy)) argh my english bad.. u dont know where i can look at good "picks" of hardware)
There isn't a real up-to-date list for hardware
im mean not about ubuntu or linux.. just "good" hardware on market )
Okay, well that depends what you want to do with it, what are your needs
litle of ruby/python, blender, world of warcraft by wine (opengl), lamp, passenger, postgres...
The new Intel i5 Sandy-bridge APU's are more than capable to play WoW, so separate video card is needed. If you need some more punch I'd go for a Nvidia GTX card
Correction: is not needed for WoW the i5 is enough
Go Intel, something with an H61 or P67 chipset
yep! any of them? or concrete?.. or Z68?
its big problem to choose for me
I have a H61 board for a HTPC in combination wth an i3 2100 and that all runs just fine
Z68 just allows you to update to the Ivy Bridge APU's
But they should all work jst fine
thx! u know any site with good reviews? or ready cheap seutps?..argh english
Not really, you should check out the comparison card on Intel's site
http://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/processor-comparison/compare-intel-processors.html
oh, thx!
